name: Turku Castle
description: A historic castle dating back to the 13th century, offering guided tours and exhibitions on Finnish history.

name: Forum Marinum Maritime Centre
description: A maritime museum showcasing Finland's naval history with ship exhibits and interative displays.

name: WAM - Turku Art Museum
description: A comptemporary art museum featuring Finnish and international artists, with rotating exhibitions.

name: Pharmacy Museum and Qwensel House
description: A unique museum located in a 18th-century pharmacy, showcasing the history of medicine and pharmacy in Finland.

name: Turku Market Hall
description: A unique indoor market featuring local produce, artisanal foods, and crafts from the Turku region.
price: Free entry, prices vary by vendor

name: Turku Cathedral
description: The oldest stone church in Finland, dating back to the 13th century, known for its stunning architecture and historical significance.

name: Kylämäki Village
description: An open air museum that recreates rural Finnish life from the 19th century, with traditional buildings and farm animals.

name: Turku City Library
description: A modern library with a vast collection of books and digital resources, offering a variety of culltural events and workshops.
price: Free entry, some events may have a fee
